metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11537 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
When ImageMagick 7.0.6-1 processes a crafted file in convert, it can leadto a Floating Point Exception (FPE) in the WritePALMImage() function incoders/palm.c, related to an incorrect bits-per-pixel calculation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11').
